comment.author: 22919290@N08
comment._content:
Some buff info as requested(!). 
The sign '10S/25D' refers to the speed limit for Steam (10mph) and Diesel (25mph) traction for crossing the Shannon Bridge. These differential speed limits were required because of the varying weight each kind of locomotive distributed onto the bridge structure. 
The photo is taken from a window in Athlone East signal cabin and the train might be heading towards the camera while operating a transfer goods between the two stations in Athlone. 
O'Dea spent many a time in the signal cabins and particularly recorded Athlone East as it was subsequently closed the following year, been replaced by automatic signals and points. The loco No.574 is a 'J5 Class 0-6-0'  Midland Great Western engine, based in the Athlone area, they were known as 'cattle engines' because their association with the heavy cattle trains in the midlands.

comment._content: Hate to be pedantic but it says in the info on the right hand side of the Flickr page that this shot was taken Dec 7th 2011, which is very much incorrect as it states it was originally taken in December 1960. It might have been 'Uploaded December of 2011' rather than what the page states on the right hand side!
